org.writeforward.logger

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.writeforward.logger.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    This represents a single message, a single log entry, sent to the logging framework. The logger creates objects of this class which get passed along in the fluent builder.
    Author:
    Matt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Message()
      A message with no meaningful content, Here for Java Bean purposes.

      This constructor has all of the slow reflection-based parameters in it.

    • Method Detail

      • toMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMap()
        Useful for templating. Turns this message into a map. Modify this method to add new keys to the Pebble formatter. Each of the properties get put into the map. All keys are lower case.The properties get stripped of endings. For example "threadName" => "thread", "lineNumber" => "line" and so on.
        • className => class
        • lineNumber => line
        • methodName => method
        • fileName => file
        • threadName => thread
        Exceptions are a different matter. Each part of the exception is broken out.
        • exception = exception.toString()
        • exception.message = exception.getLocalizedMessage()
        • exception.name = exception.getClass().getName()
        • exception.cause = exception.getCause().toString()
        • exception.stacktrace = exception.getStackTrace()
        Values take the form of the map's entry set. Use the following to access value methods: 
          
   {% for value in values %}
       {{ value.key }} {{ value.value }}
   {% else %}
       
   {% endfor %}
        Since there can be markers inside other markers, it outputs all of the marker names right next to each other. (i.e. FATAL MODULE) There is both a "timestamp", a "time" and a "date" entry which should output local dates and times. the stacktrace outputs each stack frame and then a new line. If the field is null, then this map will return a empty ("") string.
        Returns:
        A map representing this object.
